intro: Dichelostemma multiflorum, commonly known as the blue-eyed bulb, is a flowering plant native to California and parts of Oregon. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces clustered, bell-shaped flowers that are often surrounded by a white or pale blue spathe. It has a bulbous root system and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun to partial shade. Dichelostemma multiflorum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in gardens.
